data.ProductDescription: The everyday current account for everyday banking
data.CardNotes: ApplePay and AndroidPay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription: This account comes with up to £25 interest and fee free Planned Overdraft (subject to application and approval).

Eligibility.Description:
you’re aged 18 or older and a resident in the UK
or have permission to stay in the UK for at least 12 months

OverdraftPricing.OverdraftNotes: Interest and fee-free Planned Overdraft amount is £25

If you use a Planned Overdraft of £1,200 on our Classic Account, the overdraft interest rate we charge on the first £25 will be 0% EAR 
variable. The overdraft interest rate on the next £1,175 will be 19.89% EAR variable and a Monthly Overdraft Usage Fee of £6 will apply. 
EAR is the Equivalent Annual Rate. This is the actual annual rate of an overdraft. It doesn’t take into account other fees and charges.
No additional fees as long as you don’t exceed the buffer. Interest will be charged if within £10 unplanned buffer

The daily fee will be worked out at the end of each day (including weekends and Bank Holidays) on the balance of your Unplanned Overdraft. We will charge you a maximum of eight daily fees in a monthly billing period

The daily fee will be worked out at the end of each day (including weekends and Bank Holidays) on the balance of your Unplanned Overdraft. We will charge you a maximum of eight daily fees in a monthly billing period

FeeSubDetails.FeesAndChargesNotes: Payments up to and including £100;
Payments over £100

Non-sterling transaction fee: fee charged for the conversion of currency. This is a percentage value of your original transaction. 
The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

Non-sterling cash fee :fee charged for withdrawal of cash abroad using your debit card. The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

FeeDetail.Other: Charge for Foreign Cheques paid in to the account for sterling value of £100 or less,whether negotiating or collecting

FeeSubDetails.FeesAndChargesNotes: For cheque values <= £100, whether collecting or negotiating

FeeDetail.Other: Charge for Foreign Cheques paid in to the account for sterling value more than £100 where we negotiate the cheque

FeeSubDetails.FeesAndChargesNotes: For cheque values over £100: our minimum charge will be  £8 when we negotiate the cheque.

Non-sterling purchase fee: fee charged per transaction when you make a purchase (not a cash withdrawal or purchase of foreign currency or travellers cheques). fee is applicable only to debit card transactions. The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate
For cheque values over £100: Our minimum charge will be  £15 when we collect the cheque.

Foreign cash fee : fee charged if you choose to complete your debit card cash withdrawal using the ATM provider's conversion rate to sterling. The ATM provider may make a separate charge for conversion which will be included in the exchange rate offered to you. The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

BenefitDetail.BenefitDescription: Register for Save the Change and make saving easy. When you buy something with your Lloyds Bank Visa debit card (and your account is in credit), the amount can be rounded up to the nearest pound, and the difference transferred to an eligible Lloyds Bank savings account.

Each month we pay back thousands of customers for something they’ve bought on their Lloyds Bank debit or credit card, up to the value of £500 (Internet Banking and It’s On Us registration required).

Must be registered for Everyday Offers and activate the offer. Not available in Northern Ireland
Add a second person to your account. It’s a convenient way to share outgoings such as household bills, shopping and mortgage/rent payments or budget for holidays and special purchases.

Sign up for our Text Alerts, which can help you keep track of your finances. Limit Alerts tell you if you're near to or over your account limit. You can also get Balance Alerts that let you know when your balance is above or below a level set by you.

Track and manage your money with Money Manager.
Our free online service automatically organises most of your spending into helpful categories such as “Groceries”, “Entertainment” and “Public transport”. It works across your Lloyds Bank personal current accounts, savings accounts and credit card account and uses easy-to-read graphs to give you a clear picture of where your money goes.

Get up to 15% cashback using Everyday Offers at the type of places you regularly shop. It’s available to UK personal current account customers over 18, who bank online. Retailer offers and cashback amounts may vary.

Must be registered for Internet Banking and be over 18. Register online and activate each offer you want to use.

Take out up to £500 cash (or equivalent
currency) per account holder from cash
machines around the world.

data.ProductDescription: Packed with all you need to make the most of your studies
data.CardNotes: ApplePay and AndroidPay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
•Setting up a Planned Overdraft is free.
•In your first year, you can apply for a Planned Overdraft where there is an interest and fee-free amount of up to: 
- £500 for the first 6 months from account opening,
- £1,000 from month 7 from account opening,
- £1,500 from month 10 from account opening.

•In your second and third year, your Planned Overdraft can be up to £1,500
•In your fourth year and above, your Planned Overdraft can be up to £2,000
•You can find all the information you need about Planned Overdrafts for students in our Student Account welcome pack
FeatureDetails.CriteriaType: All applications are subject to a review of your personal circumstances.

Eligibility.Description: To apply for a Lloyds Bank Student Account you must be 17 or over, have been a resident in the UK for at least three years and be studying for a full-time course that lasts for a minimum of two years or be on a one year access course leading onto a full-time degree
Eligibility.EligibilityNotes: Should have been a resident in the UK for at least three years and be studying for a full-time course that lasts for a minimum of two years or be on a one year access course leading onto a full-time degree

OverdraftPricing.OverdraftNotes: Eligible up to £500 for the first 6 months from account opening. If you use a Planned Overdraft of £1,800 in your second year the overdraft interest rate we will charge on the first £1,500 will be 0% EAR  variable and a monthly overdraft usage fee will not apply. The overdraft interest rate on the next £300 will be 8.21% EAR variable and a monthly overdraft usage fee of £6 will apply.
No additional fees as long as you don’t exceed the buffer. Interest will be charged if within £10 unplanned buffer

Eligible up to £1,000 from month 7 from account opening. If you use a Planned Overdraft of £1,800 in your second year the overdraft interest rate we will charge on the first £1,500 will be 0% EAR variable and a monthly overdraft usage fee will not apply. The overdraft interest rate on the next £300 will be 8.21% EAR variable and a monthly overdraft usage fee of £6 will apply.
No additional fees as long as you don’t exceed the buffer. Interest will be charged if within £10 unplanned buffer

Eligible up to £1,500 from month 10 from account opening or In your second and third year, your Planned Overdraft can be up to £1,500.If you use a Planned Overdraft of £1,800 in your second year the overdraft interest rate we will charge on the first £1,500 will be 0% EAR variable and a monthly overdraft usage fee will not apply. The overdraft interest rate on the next £300 will be 8.21% EAR variable and a monthly overdraft usage fee of £6 will apply.
No additional fees as long as you don’t exceed the buffer. Interest will be charged if within £10 unplanned buffer

In your fourth year and above, your Planned Overdraft can be up to £2,000. If you use a Planned Overdraft of £1,800 in your second year the overdraft interest rate we will charge on the first £1,500 will be 0% EAR 
 variable and a monthly overdraft usage fee will not apply. The overdraft interest rate on the next £300 will be 8.21% EAR variable and a monthly overdraft usage fee of £6 will apply.
No additional fees as long as you don’t exceed the buffer. Interest will be charged if within £10 unplanned buffer

BenefitDetail.BenefitDescription:
Get up to 15% cashback using Everyday Offers at the type of places you regularly shop. It’s available to UK personal current account customers over 18, who bank online. Retailer offers and cashback amounts may vary.

Must be registered for Internet Banking and be over 18. Register online and activate each offer you want to use.

Each month we pay back thousands of customers for something they’ve bought on their Lloyds Bank debit or credit card, up to the value of £500 (Internet Banking and It’s On Us registration required).

Must be registered for Everyday Offers and activate the offer. Not available in Northern Ireland
Sign up for our Text Alerts, which can help you keep track of your finances.
Keep track of your spending and see at a glance where your money goes with our free Internet Banking service.

Register for Save the Change and make saving easy. When you buy something with your Lloyds Bank Visa debit card (and your account is in credit), the amount can be rounded up to the nearest pound, and the difference transferred to an eligible Lloyds Bank savings account.

machines around the world.

data.ProductDescription: Packed with benefits for only £17 per month
data.CardNotes: ApplePay and AndroidPay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
Multi-trip Worldwide travel cover for you and your family (includes, if eligible, your spouse, civil partner or partner and children)
Covers certain Winter Sports
Covers UK leisure travel when two or more consecutive nights’ accommodation is booked
Comprehensive cover including:
Emergency medical cover (up to £10,000,000)
Cancellation or curtailment cover (up to £5,000)
Personal accident cover (up to £30,000)
Baggage cover (up to £2,500, £500 of which for valuables)
Travel disruption cover (up to £5,000)
FeatureDetails.FeatureValue:
Children must travel with you, your spouse, civil partner or partner or a responsible adult
The standard maximum trip duration is 45 consecutive days (for Winter Sports maximum 31 days cover in any calendar year
£40 excess may apply
Medical conditions that you and anyone to be covered have, or have had, if they are not all on the ‘No Screen Conditions’ list, must be declared and cover agreed with the insurer (there may be an additional premium if the insurer agrees to cover the condition(s))
All cover stops on your 80th birthday. As long as you are under 80 your spouse, civil partner or partner will also be covered until they reach 80

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
Includes Roadside Assistance, Home Start and Relay
Customer covered, not the vehicle
FeatureDetails.FeatureValue: Service is only available in the UK, Channel Islands and Isle of Man

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
Insures one phone on a sole account and two phones for joint accounts
Repair or replacement phone up to a maximum of £2,000 (including VAT)
Covers loss, theft, damage or breakdown (including faults)
FeatureDetails.FeatureValue: Excess is £100 for Apple iPhone claims, £50 for all other handsets

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
With one call day or night, Citymain can request card issuers cancel all financial cards and issue replacements where possible
You can register the cards for your family if they live with you
You can also register your passport and driving licence numbers with Citymain for easy access should you lose them

Eligibility.Description:
you’re aged 18 or older and a resident in the UK
you’re an EU national, or have permission to stay in the UK for at least 12 months

OverdraftPricing.OverdraftNotes: Interest and fee-free Planned Overdraft amount is £300

Representative example:For a Planned Overdraft of £1,200, the interest rate on the first £300 is 0% EAR variable. On the next £900 the interest rate is 19.89% EAR variable, with a monthly overdraft usage fee of £6.
If account balance is within the Unplanned Overdraft buffer of £10, then debit interest will be charged on that amount but will not be charged any Unplanned Overdraft Fees.

data.ProductDescription: The easy way for children and teens to make the most of their money
data.CardNotes: ApplePay and AndroidPay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
Earn a competitive variable rate of interest of 1.50% AER (1.49% gross) on money in your account up to £2,500. Interest is paid quarterly directly into your account and you will not earn credit
interest on balances of £2,500 and above

Eligibility.Description:
11-17 year olds can apply
If you’re older, you may consider a Classic Account or a Student Account if you’re in full-time education.

CreditInterestItem.InterestNotes: As an Under 19s account holder, you will earn a variable rate of interest of 1.50% AER (1.49% gross) on balances up to £2,500. You will not earn credit interest on balances of £2,500 or over. You will be paid this quarterly.

Save up to £75.99 with the AA Driving School and drive down the cost of getting your licence (if you're 17 or over). Save £36 on AA driving lessons and receive a free ‘Pass Your Test’ CD-ROM worth £19.99. After passing your test save a further £20 off Pass Plus - the DSA recognised qualification for advanced practical skills which could secure a discount of up to 35% on car insurance

data.ProductDescription: Basic Account is available to anyone applying for one of our accounts from an EU country outside the UK, and to UK citizens who are not eligible for one of our other current accounts.

Eligibility.Description:
Eligibility of EU residents and UK customers - You may be able to get a Basic Account if you do not meet the conditions for one of our other current accounts such as a Classic Account. This might be because you are bankrupt, in financial difficulty, or if we are not able to obtain information about your credit history (for example, because you live outside the UK).
- If you live in the UK  - You cannot apply for a Basic account directly. If you apply for one of our other current accounts, we will try to obtain information about your credit history to decide the most appropriate account for you.

FeeSubDetails.FeesAndChargesNotes: Payments up to and including £100; excluding payments from EU to a Basic Account, for which we waive the £2 fee
Payments over £100; excluding payments from EU to a Basic Account, for which we waive the £7 fee

The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate
Excluding payments to EU from a Basic Account, for which we waive the £9.50 fee
For cheque values over £100: our minimum charge will be  £15  when we Collect the cheque

The ATM provider may make a separate charge for conversion which will be included in the exchange rate offered to you. The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

data.ProductDescription:
2% AER (1.98% gross p.a.) variable credit interest on balances £1 to £5,000 and more great benefits.

Club Lloyds has no monthly account fee if you pay in £1,500 per month, otherwise it costs just £3 per month.
data.CardNotes: ApplePay and AndroidPay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription: This account comes with up to £100 interest and fee free Planned Overdraft (subject to application and approval).
Stay in control of your account. For £10 a month, Control stops your Classic Account from incurring Returned Item Fees, and prevents your account from going into an Unplanned Overdraft
6 cinema tickets to use during the year at over 80 locations across the UK.
FeatureDetails.CriteriaType: As a Club Lloyds member, you can choose one Lifestyle Benefit per account per year. You can pick a different one for each account every year, as long as you remain a Club Lloyds customer.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
Annual magazine subscription

You can Choose 1 Magazine out of the 25 magazines available for club lloyds members to have delivered to your door or downloadable to your device (compatible with Apple and some titles compatible with Android™ devices
FeatureDetails.CriteriaType: As a Club Lloyds member, you can choose one Lifestyle Benefit per account per year. You can pick a different one for each account every year, as long as you remain a Club Lloyds customer.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
Annual Gourmet Society membership

Gourmet Society membership gives you discounts at more than 6,000 restaurants around the UK and Ireland, giving you to unlimited access to offers such as:
2 for 1 meals
25% off your total bill
50% off food
FeatureDetails.CriteriaType: As a Club Lloyds member, you can choose one Lifestyle Benefit per account per year. You can pick a different one for each account every year, as long as you remain a Club Lloyds customer.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
As a Club Lloyds customer you’ll get exclusive access to offers on a range of Lloyds Bank products including:

discounted mortgage rates,
preferential savings rates,
home insurance discounts, and
a credit card offer.

2% AER variable credit interest on your entire balance from £1 to £5,000

Earn variable credit interest on balances between £1 and £5,000 when you pay at least two separate Direct Debits from your Club Lloyds current account each calendar month.
FeatureDetails.CriteriaType: Club Lloyds has a £3 monthly account fee which is  every month you do not pay £1,500 or more into your account.

CreditInterestItem.InterestNotes: For example, if you have £4,000 in your account for one year, you'll receive an interest rate of 2% AER/1.98% gross variable on your entire balance, provided you pay two separate Direct Debits from your Club Lloyds current account each calendar month

Packed with insurance benefits. Also includes 2% AER variable credit interest and more great benefits through Club Lloyds. The Club Lloyds Platinum monthly account fee comprises of:

Platinum Account monthly account fee of £17 per month
Plus

Club Lloyds monthly account fee is Free or £3 per month.
The £3 fee is waived for each month you pay in at least £1,500 into your account.  If in any month you don't pay in this amount, you will need to pay the £3 monthly account fee.
Maximum combined monthly account fee of £20 per month.
data.CardNotes: ApplePay and AndroidPay: Card and account type restrictions include: Electron cards, Visa credit cards and additional credit card holders, non-personal accounts, Basic Bank Accounts and customers under 13 years.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
6 cinema tickets to use during the year at over 80 locations across the UK.
Cinema tickets can be used for standard 2D admission ticket and can also be used as part Tickets are valid for 12 months.
FeatureDetails.CriteriaType: As a Club Lloyds member, you can choose one Lifestyle Benefit per account per year. You can pick a different one for each account every year, as long as you remain a Club Lloyds customer.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
Annual magazine subscription

You can Choose 1  magazine out of the 25 magazines available for club lloyds members to have delivered to your door or downloadable to your device (compatible with Apple and some titles compatible with Android™ devices
FeatureDetails.CriteriaType: As a Club Lloyds member, you can choose one Lifestyle Benefit per account per year. You can pick a different one for each account every year, as long as you remain a Club Lloyds customer.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
Annual Gourmet Society membership

Gourmet Society membership gives you discounts at more than 6,000 restaurants around the UK and Ireland, giving you to unlimited access to offers such as:
2 for 1 meals
25% off your total bill
50% off food
FeatureDetails.CriteriaType: As a Club Lloyds member, you can choose one Lifestyle Benefit per account per year. You can pick a different one for each account every year, as long as you remain a Club Lloyds customer.

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
Multi-trip Worldwide travel cover for you and your family (includes, if eligible, your spouse, civil partner or partner and children)
Covers certain Winter Sports
Covers UK leisure travel when two or more consecutive nights’ accommodation is booked
Comprehensive cover including:
Emergency medical cover (up to £10,000,000)
Cancellation or curtailment cover (up to £5,000)
Personal accident cover (up to £30,000)
Baggage cover (up to £2,500, £500 of which for valuables)
Travel disruption cover (up to £5,000)
FeatureDetails.FeatureValue:
Children must travel with you, your spouse, civil partner or partner or a responsible adult
The standard maximum trip duration is 45 consecutive days (for Winter Sports maximum 31 days cover in any calendar year
£40 excess may apply
Medical conditions that you and anyone to be covered have, or have had, if they are not all on the ‘No Screen Conditions’ list, must be declared and cover agreed with the insurer (there may be an additional premium if the insurer agrees to cover the condition(s))
All cover stops on your 80th birthday. As long as you are under 80 your spouse, civil partner or partner will also be covered until they reach 80

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
Includes Roadside Assistance, Home Start and Relay
Customer covered, not the vehicle
FeatureDetails.FeatureValue: Service is only available in the UK, Channel Islands and Isle of Man

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
Insures one phone on a sole account and two phones for joint accounts
Repair or replacement phone up to a maximum of £2,000 (including VAT)
Covers loss, theft, damage or breakdown (including faults)
FeatureDetails.FeatureValue: Excess is £100 for Apple iPhone claims, £50 for all other handsets

FeatureDetails.FeatureDescription:
With one call day or night, Citymain can request card issuers cancel all financial cards and issue replacements where possible
You can register the cards for your family if they live with you
You can also register your passport and driving licence numbers with Citymain for easy access should you lose them

As a Club Lloyds customer you’ll get exclusive access to offers on a range of Lloyds Bank products including:

discounted mortgage rates,
preferential savings rates,
home insurance discounts, and
a credit card offer.

2% AER variable credit interest on your entire balance from £1 to £5,000

Earn variable credit interest on balances between £1 and £5,000 when you pay at least two separate Direct Debits from your Club Lloyds current account each calendar month
FeatureDetails.CriteriaType: Club Lloyds has a £3 monthly account fee which is  every month you do not pay £1,500 or more into your account.

Eligibility.Description:
you’re aged 18 or older and a resident in the UK
you’re an EU national, or have permission to stay in the UK for at least 12 months

CreditInterestItem.InterestNotes: For example, if you have £4,000 in your account for one year, you'll receive an interest rate of 2% AER/1.98% gross variable on your entire balance, provided you pay two separate Direct Debits from your Club Lloyds current account each calendar month

OverdraftPricing.OverdraftNotes: Interest and fee-free Planned Overdraft amount is £300

Representative example:For a Planned Overdraft of £1,200, the interest rate on the first £300 is 0% EAR variable. On the next £900 the interest rate is 19.89% EAR variable, with a monthly overdraft usage fee of £6.
No additional fees as long as you don’t exceed the buffer. Interest will be charged if within £10 unplanned buffer

FeeSubDetails.FeesAndChargesNotes: Payments up to and including £100;
Payments over £100

Non-sterling cash fee :fee charged for withdrawal of cash abroad using your debit card. The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

Non-sterling purchase fee: fee charged per transaction when you make a purchase (not a cash withdrawal or purchase of foreign currency or travellers cheques). fee is applicable only to debit card transactions. If you have a Platinum debit card, we won’t charge the usual non-sterling purchase fee of £1 when you use it to make purchases in a foreign currency.

FeeDetail.Other: Charge for Foreign Cheques paid in to the account for sterling value of £100 or less, whether negotiating or collecting

FeeSubDetails.FeesAndChargesNotes: For cheque values <= £100, whether collecting or negotiating

FeeDetail.Other: Charge for Foreign Cheques paid in to the account for sterling value more than £100 where we negotiate the cheque

FeeSubDetails.FeesAndChargesNotes: For cheque values over £100: our minimum charge will be  £8 when we negotiate the cheque.

Non-sterling purchase fee: fee charged per transaction when you make a purchase (not a cash withdrawal or purchase of foreign currency or travellers cheques). fee is applicable only to debit card transactions. If you have a Platinum debit card, we won’t charge the usual non-sterling purchase fee of £1 when you use it to make purchases in a foreign currency.
For cheque values over £100: Our minimum charge will be  £15 when we collect the cheque.
Monthly account fee

Foreign cash fee : fee charged if you choose to complete your debit card cash withdrawal using the ATM provider's conversion rate to sterling. The ATM provider may make a separate charge for conversion which will be included in the exchange rate offered to you. The amount is converted to sterling on the day it is processed by Visa using the Visa Payment Scheme Exchange Rate

BenefitDetail.BenefitDescription:
Get up to 15% cashback using Everyday Offers at the type of places you regularly shop. It’s available to UK personal current account customers over 18, who bank online. Retailer offers and cashback amounts may vary.

Must be registered for Internet Banking and be over 18. Register online and activate each offer you want to use.

Sign up for our Text Alerts, which can help you keep track of your finances. Limit Alerts tell you if you're near to or over your account limit. You can also get Balance Alerts that let you know when your balance is above or below a level set by you.
Keep track of your spending and see at a glance where your money goes with our free Internet Banking service.

Register for Save the Change and make saving easy. When you buy something with your Lloyds Bank Visa debit card (and your account is in credit), the amount can be rounded up to the nearest pound, and the difference transferred to an eligible Lloyds Bank savings account.
Add a second person to your account. It’s a convenient way to share outgoings such as household bills, shopping and mortgage/rent payments or budget for holidays and special purchases.

Each month we pay back thousands of customers for something they’ve bought on their Lloyds Bank debit or credit card, up to the value of £500 (Internet Banking and It’s On Us registration required).

Must be registered for Everyday Offers and activate the offer. Not available in Northern Ireland

Take out up to £500 cash (or equivalent
currency) per account holder from cash
machines around the world.
